data.what_is: SAP Marketing Cloud enables personal, connected journeys that improve customer conversion, drive loyalty and increase marketing's contribution to the bottom line.  Deliver meaningful engagements based on customer context and consent, anticipate and deliver on needs with machine-driven intelligence and close the loop on measurement to ensure performance and budget optimization.
data.product_description: SAP Marketing Cloud helps marketers deliver personalized experiences with a unified view of the customer, optimize marketing with closed-loop measurement, and drive intelligent, consent-driven engagement to increase demand and growth. The software provides several scenarios including: dynamic customer profiling, marketing planning and performance, audiences, campaigns, and journey management, lead and account-based marketing, and marketing analytics.

initial_reviews.review_title: SAP Marketing Cloud finally, a budgeting tool built for marketing.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
I like that I can see all of my budget in one place, that I can easily add email invoices, and that I can link marketing spend directly to campaigns. SAP Marketing Cloud provides you with instant and complete visibility into your marketing budget, allowing you to make a strategic turn or seize an opportunity with confidence. You can securely delegate spend management to your team with SAP Marketing Cloud and know what's being spent, committed, planned, budgeted, and what's remaining. To begin, this capacity is vital to so much more: performance management. /goals.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
To become a power user of the platform, there is a high learning curve; successful use needs the marketing leader to set precise and consistent definitions and granularity of objectives, campaigns, expenditure groups, and other sorts of data. When it comes to building a data structure around something as amorphous as Marketing, one might easily conclude that this is life. I really want our teams would start using the planning tools for goals and objectives and then tie spending to them, however there is only one team choice.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Maintain track of our own budget rather than waiting for accounting to tell us what is missing, attribution of spending, being able to make budget judgments owing to the tool's high level of transparency Using SAP Marketing Cloud, I was able to spend less time monitoring marketing budgets and more time selling actual work product. I can have effective dialogues about expenditure predictions with the CFO, program performance with the CRO, and strategic focus and appropriate resources with the CEO using SAP Marketing Cloud.

initial_reviews.review_title: Complete Review of SAP Marketing Cloud
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The SAP Marketing Cloud provides insight into how our product's sales are occurring. We have various weekly dashboards, which are helpful for multiple data modeling in our organization and help make more accurate business decisions.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The data modeling and creating story points are complex as there are not many blogs or tutorials available at the moment regarding the SAP Marketing Cloud. There is various customization required to make it business relevant.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can get more insights into how the customer feels about our product from the sales information. This is also helping us to understand which products are not selling well . This feedback helps us with our financial business decision.

initial_reviews.review_title: SAP Marketing Cloud is easy to use for your marketing roadmaps and budget overview.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Having a rapid overview of all campaigns and the ability to dive down into specific activities, as well as the budget and cost area, which offers an overview of your intended budget by month, quarter, and year. With SAP Marketing Cloud, it is possible to operate both alone and cooperatively within a team; individual and extremely detailed job management provides several benefits in huge teams. The program gives a comprehensive picture of all campaigns and their marketing efforts without requiring extensive searching, and the system is simple to use and can be tailored to your individual needs.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
There are no big flaws in the system, and minor ones (bugs and faults) are rapidly resolved by the SAP Marketing Cloud support and development team. It can be difficult to design campaigns and marketing actions at times, but this should be expected, If a newer version is released that addresses these flaws, the design can be made more current in my opinion.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
SAP Marketing Cloud assists with budget and cost planning, allowing for improved cost transparency and budget allocation by channel, you may assess the performance of your campaigns using the control panel. We gain from SAP Marketing Cloud because we have a solution that combines task management and campaign management, allowing us to organize our actions much more efficiently.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
In terms of pricing and features, this is the best platform, there are too many systems that require extra fees to use complex features, such as A/B testing or CRM connectivity, while SAP Marketing Cloud includes everything. While it isn't the most user-friendly marketing analytics software in the world, having all of our customer and marketing data in one place is convenient, another fantastic value is real-time information, which eliminates the need to worry about data transfer or marketing data accuracy.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
When configuring drip programs, the user interface is less aesthetically appealing than on other platforms; this just takes some getting used to when first configuring the system, but it is simple to use after that. The email campaign server integration has restrictions that require only SAP subscription; it was not possible to do it from our local email server; it would be nice to have things more simplified; any kind of integration with another system is practically impossible, which is a significant limitation.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
SAP Marketing Cloud offers most of the functionality that larger, more expensive platforms offer at a fraction of the price, the advantages include that marketing campaigns are based on real-time data, data cleansing is also a very easy system, segmentation (again time consuming) is also very system friendly, and the problem being addressed is traditional data. is a matter of consistency, including working within a single system. Multiple systems are involved.

initial_reviews.review_title: SAP Marketing Cloud changed the way we identify and track leads.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
We can use SAP Marketing Cloud to see who has visited our website, when they visited, and which pages they saw, as well as correlate this to our email campaign metrics, this enables us to nurture selected prospects with additional automated emails, I really enjoy the ability to track prospects, businesses, and other visitors to the website and score them depending on various activities they do both on the site and in response to emails they receive from us. The email repetition capability is very important with our offering because we have consumers that require our daily emails, the ability to transmit something at the same time every day for a set amount of time.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
As compared to specialist email campaign builders like Mail Chimp or Campaign Monitor, the HTML email campaign builder is a little clunky, and not as much analytics information is shown after sending campaigns. In addition, we had a major issue with the rerun system for months, and while it was finally resolved, it was a pain in the ass for a long time. I'd also want to see a more robust email reporting system, both for individual contacts receiving emails and for specific emails.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using SAP Marketing Cloud, we can more efficiently monitor our website and the efficacy of individual initiatives, your capacity to generate leads and track specific visits and trends has had a beneficial impact on our performance, for which we are appreciative. With SAP Marketing Cloud, we can track and qualify leads from email clicks to website viewing patterns, allowing us to provide higher-quality leads to the sales team. We haven't used it to its full capacity yet, but based on the outcomes we've seen so far, it has a lot of promise.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The best thing about SAP Marketing Cloud is that it supports multi-channel marketing, allows businesses to reach their customers across various channels, including email, social media, mobile etc. It provides collaboration tools that enable marketing teams to work together more effectively. Teams can collaborate on campaigns, share assets and insights, and monitor performance metrics in real-time.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
SAP Marketing Cloud is tightly integrated with other SAP products which means that businesses may become dependent on SAP for their marketing operations and may face challenges if they want to switch to a different platform in the future.
While SAP Marketing Cloud can integrate with third-party systems, the number of available integrations is limited

all_reviews.review_title: SAP Marketing Cloud finally, a budgeting tool built for marketing.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
I like that I can see all of my budget in one place, that I can easily add email invoices, and that I can link marketing spend directly to campaigns. SAP Marketing Cloud provides you with instant and complete visibility into your marketing budget, allowing you to make a strategic turn or seize an opportunity with confidence. You can securely delegate spend management to your team with SAP Marketing Cloud and know what's being spent, committed, planned, budgeted, and what's remaining. To begin, this capacity is vital to so much more: performance management. /goals.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
To become a power user of the platform, there is a high learning curve; successful use needs the marketing leader to set precise and consistent definitions and granularity of objectives, campaigns, expenditure groups, and other sorts of data. When it comes to building a data structure around something as amorphous as Marketing, one might easily conclude that this is life. I really want our teams would start using the planning tools for goals and objectives and then tie spending to them, however there is only one team choice.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Maintain track of our own budget rather than waiting for accounting to tell us what is missing, attribution of spending, being able to make budget judgments owing to the tool's high level of transparency Using SAP Marketing Cloud, I was able to spend less time monitoring marketing budgets and more time selling actual work product. I can have effective dialogues about expenditure predictions with the CFO, program performance with the CRO, and strategic focus and appropriate resources with the CEO using SAP Marketing Cloud.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Having a rapid overview of all campaigns and the ability to dive down into specific activities, as well as the budget and cost area, which offers an overview of your intended budget by month, quarter, and year. With SAP Marketing Cloud, it is possible to operate both alone and cooperatively within a team; individual and extremely detailed job management provides several benefits in huge teams. The program gives a comprehensive picture of all campaigns and their marketing efforts without requiring extensive searching, and the system is simple to use and can be tailored to your individual needs.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
There are no big flaws in the system, and minor ones (bugs and faults) are rapidly resolved by the SAP Marketing Cloud support and development team. It can be difficult to design campaigns and marketing actions at times, but this should be expected, If a newer version is released that addresses these flaws, the design can be made more current in my opinion.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
SAP Marketing Cloud assists with budget and cost planning, allowing for improved cost transparency and budget allocation by channel, you may assess the performance of your campaigns using the control panel. We gain from SAP Marketing Cloud because we have a solution that combines task management and campaign management, allowing us to organize our actions much more efficiently.

In terms of pricing and features, this is the best platform, there are too many systems that require extra fees to use complex features, such as A/B testing or CRM connectivity, while SAP Marketing Cloud includes everything. While it isn't the most user-friendly marketing analytics software in the world, having all of our customer and marketing data in one place is convenient, another fantastic value is real-time information, which eliminates the need to worry about data transfer or marketing data accuracy.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
When configuring drip programs, the user interface is less aesthetically appealing than on other platforms; this just takes some getting used to when first configuring the system, but it is simple to use after that. The email campaign server integration has restrictions that require only SAP subscription; it was not possible to do it from our local email server; it would be nice to have things more simplified; any kind of integration with another system is practically impossible, which is a significant limitation.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
SAP Marketing Cloud offers most of the functionality that larger, more expensive platforms offer at a fraction of the price, the advantages include that marketing campaigns are based on real-time data, data cleansing is also a very easy system, segmentation (again time consuming) is also very system friendly, and the problem being addressed is traditional data. is a matter of consistency, including working within a single system. Multiple systems are involved.

all_reviews.review_title: SAP Marketing Cloud changed the way we identify and track leads.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
We can use SAP Marketing Cloud to see who has visited our website, when they visited, and which pages they saw, as well as correlate this to our email campaign metrics, this enables us to nurture selected prospects with additional automated emails, I really enjoy the ability to track prospects, businesses, and other visitors to the website and score them depending on various activities they do both on the site and in response to emails they receive from us. The email repetition capability is very important with our offering because we have consumers that require our daily emails, the ability to transmit something at the same time every day for a set amount of time.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
As compared to specialist email campaign builders like Mail Chimp or Campaign Monitor, the HTML email campaign builder is a little clunky, and not as much analytics information is shown after sending campaigns. In addition, we had a major issue with the rerun system for months, and while it was finally resolved, it was a pain in the ass for a long time. I'd also want to see a more robust email reporting system, both for individual contacts receiving emails and for specific emails.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using SAP Marketing Cloud, we can more efficiently monitor our website and the efficacy of individual initiatives, your capacity to generate leads and track specific visits and trends has had a beneficial impact on our performance, for which we are appreciative. With SAP Marketing Cloud, we can track and qualify leads from email clicks to website viewing patterns, allowing us to provide higher-quality leads to the sales team. We haven't used it to its full capacity yet, but based on the outcomes we've seen so far, it has a lot of promise.

What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?

Teams can collaborate on campaigns, share assets and insights, and monitor performance metrics in real-time.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
SAP Marketing Cloud is tightly integrated with other SAP products which means that businesses may become dependent on SAP for their marketing operations and may face challenges if they want to switch to a different platform in the future.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing system and support
Very powerfull marketing platform that is missing some basic things
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Segmentation is one of the highlights of this tool. It is fast, powerful and easy to use.
Contact match and merge process is also something worth mentioning. SAP Marketing Cloud generate a golden record of a contact that can be generated from multiple sources. This helps your marketing to work with "people" and not just "contacts".
Also the data set that you can work with is well thought out - there is a lot of prebuild objects that you can use (interactions, products, interests, agreements). But if you have a need, you can allways create your own and connect it to other objects in the system.
SAP Marketing Cloud also allows you to integrate in almost any way possible.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Comparing it to most other marketing platforms that do marketing automation, SAP Marketing Cloud really should have a native universal web tracker. There is one if you also use SAP Commerce Cloud but in all other cases there is not any good solutions for this. There is an option for Google Analytics integration but requires SAP Cloud Platfrom Integration and it messess with your utm_campaign tags because it uses the campaign ID instead of some name that can be understood by humans.

Then there are features that could be made better if native web tracking was available. Form prefill (not jut on the page after email click), progressive profiling on forms, ...

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it to generate and work with new leads.
But we mainly use it to work with our existing customers and perform lifecycle marketing - so we have a lot of automated campaign that can respond to contact events.

all_reviews.review_title: SAP Marketing Cloud is Solid.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Because we use SAP Cloud of Customer as our CRM system, using SAP Marketing Cloud makes sense. While not the most user friendly marketing analytics platform in the world, it's nice to have all of our customer data and marketing data in one place. Real-time information is another huge asset, and we don't have to worry about transferring data back and forth - or marketing data integrity, for that matter.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Everything is a bit cumbersome in the system - it seems like anything you want to do requires a TON of steps to execute. It'd be nice to have things more streamlined! Any type of integration with another system is virtually impossible, which is a significant limitation.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
This will be a good solution if you use it in conjunction with SAP CRM. If not, I'd recommend looking at another platform, such as Marketo or Hubspot.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Benefits include making sure our marketing campaigns are based on real-time data! And data clean-up is pretty easy in the system as well. Segmentation (again, while time-consuming), is also really easy in the system!

Problems being solved are prior data integrity issues and working within one system (rather than being involved in multiple systems).

all_reviews.review_title: Very good program if you have ITs support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Its in-depth user buying/engagement cycle from start to finish as well as the built in insights and recommendations for extending communication to the customer.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
There's no try-then-buy. And you have to have SAP in order to use it.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
Think about what you need before using this application. If you are a part of an organization that is hungry to expand upon customer experience, user data within e-commerce platforms and very serious about linking social/digital touchpoints with buying trends, then this may be a very worthy consideration. Also consider, this is not a try and buy type product; our organization bought SAP and this was one of the (many) add-ons that was purchased separately within the SAP integration. Also, our company is a large manufacturing company with hundreds of thousands of SKUs-- consider more agile platforms if you are a SaaS or are responsible for fewer numbers of SKUs.

The robustness of the platform was very impressive; the insights from the first touchpoint to the latest, the user's trends, syncing social media touchpoints, understanding their cart, synching the user with other users within their company to understand their correlations (influencer, buyer, etc) was very impressive. it wasn't just a broad-brush or best-guess approach to understanding the customer's journey.

Being able to import mockups and allow for digital editing seemed to be a very pleasing feature; we currently have Workfront implemented within my organization to take care of job management and proofing while SAPHM is in the throes of implementation. However, once SAPHM is implemented, we will begin to discuss how we want to continue our relationship with our proofing software vendors.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are closing the gap between internal business knowledge and what the customer wants to hear. We've operated far too long assuming customer thoughts, vernacular and trends and this brings all of that to light.

I work with a variety of marketing automation platforms and in a comparison of cost and features this is the ideal platform for the majority of our clients.  Too many platforms charge additional fees to use the advanced, such as A/B testing or CRM integration, but Callidus Cloud has everything included.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
Have a marketing plan/strategy ready to go when you start the system.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Many companies we work with are interested in marketing automation, but are concerned with high initial costs.  Callidus Cloud provides the majority of the features that the larger more expensive platforms offer, but at a fraction of the price.

all_reviews.review_title: Callidus Cloud...Better than 'meh'
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
I definitely like the ability to track prospects, companies, etc. that are visiting the website, and the ability to score them based on different actions they take both on the site, and actions related to emails they receive from us. The email rerun function is pretty key with our product as well, as we have customers who need to receive daily emails from us. Being able to schedule something to send at the same time everyday for a definite time period has improved the quality of my life, not just my work.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
There are several glitches and issues I have with CallidusCloud. One of which being that I have received the same 'open report' email from them on one email about 20 times today. It's starting to get annoying. Usually it's a very predictable program, but sometimes it seems to have a mind of its own. Also, the I had a huge issue with the rerun system for months, and although it eventually got ironed out, it was a pain in the you know what for a long time. I also wish there was a better email reporting system, both for individual contacts receiving emails, and for specific emails.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
Definitely check out other programs. If you have a decent amount of money to spend on marketing automation, check around, as other programs may be a little more user friendly. Callidus is good at what it does, and has a pretty competitive price point for all of the features and benefits it offers.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're able to monitor our website and performance of specific campaigns much more effectively with Callidus. Their ability to score leads and monitor specific visits and patterns have directly affected our bottom line in a positive way, and for that we are grateful.

all_reviews.review_title: Revolutionises how we identify and track leads
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Based on matching companies (and leads) to IP addresses, we can see who has visited our website, when, and what pages they have viewed as well as link this in to our email campaign analytics. This enables us to follow up on identified leads with further automated emails to nurture. Our sales team enjoy being able to track website views and link up to existing sales efforts through Sales Force.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The HTML email campaign builder in Leadformix is a little glitchy compared to dedicated email campaign builders such as Mail Chimp or Campaign Monitor. Not as much analytical info shown after sending campaigns out. That said, our spam bounce rate is lower as the click through links aren't redirects - instead, the code on the website tracks those coming in from the email campaigns so the click through data is still there. The workflow builder takes a little getting used to but we're planning on testing it soon.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
It's not the sort of programme you can walk in to and use straight away. Set time aside for training as it is much needed.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead generation is fundamental for us. By being able to track and qualify leads from email clicks, through to viewing habits on our website, we are able to send better quality leads through to the sales team. We don't use it to its full extent yet, but there is great potential based on the results we've already seen.

all_reviews.review_title: Enterprise-level marketing automation at an affordable price.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Our company does many email marketing campaigns in the course of a month, and the previous tool we used was cumbersome to set up and non-user-friendly in its reporting. Callidus Cloud makes campaign set up easy, allows full HTML editing capabilities, and the graphical reporting is easy to look at. I now receive automated reports with all the key stats I need right at my fingertips.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
We are currently integrating Callidus Cloud with our SugarCRM system, but it's not as up-to-speed as we need it to be. They've done more integration with Salesforce, but Sugar is right up there as an industry leader in cloud-based CRM, so the integration needs to catch up.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
Try it out. Do one campaign and you'll find out for yourself how easy it is to use. And with a price at a fraction of other software that does the same tasks, you'll be convinced.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Primarily email marketing and data analysis of campaign results. We also use the website tracking tools, and we're beginning to use the workflow automation to start "drip marketing" campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Leadformix has transformed the way Nurture Marketing does Business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
I like the set it and forget it features of the workflow and e-mail modules.  Once an identified visitor to www.nurturemarketing.com reaches a certain score they are added to a list that kicks off a set of nurture based e-mails automatically.  A great productivity feature for the Nurture team!

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The Campaign Module should provide e-mail statistics and details based upon a series of e-Mails, not only general web statistics as it provides today.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
Consider hiring an integrator/reseller that understands your business.  This is a self-serving statement but one that I wholeheartedly believe.  Assign a LeadFormix champion within your organization and have a plan to utilize the entire product.  It's easy to overlook the power of the complete product when you're so impressed with a module or 2.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead generation is the number 1 problem Leadformix solves for us.  We have a limited sales team with limited resources, Leadformix performs like a member of my team identifying leads and automatically nurturing them until they are ready to buy.  My sales team is more productive because they are only speaking with people ready to close.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Idea, Poor Execution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The system is great for automated email marketing campaigns. Drip campaigns with prewritten emails that are sent to prospects over a period of time can be very helpful for getting signups months after initial contact.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The system is very buggy. We haven't had a great experience with their customer support and I would be wary of signing up with them again as a result.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
Make sure that you have a full understanding of what the product does and how it will work for your business before you decide to purchase. Any software is only as good as the implementation. It can do a lot of really interesting things that will have 0 impact on your business if you don't set it up properly.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
The business problem that we're solving is that it is expensive to have an employee manually send emails to lists of leads on a weekly or monthly basis to keep in touch with them. Instead we've automated that process so that we can write the email once, set it in a campaign and then the prospects will receive the email at the expected time.

all_reviews.review_title: Using CallidusCloud integrated with salesforce.com for marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The marketing automation features of the system are great, and what's best is the training that's available.  Both the live training with a subject matter expert and the recorded webcasts and presentations are extremely helpful.  The system has allowed us to easily create marketing automation campaigns leveraging our prospect data in salesforce, and currently helping us with both ongoing outbound marketing as well as lead scoring.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Creating marketing automation / drip campaigns is a bit complex and takes awhile to figure out, but once set up, work very well.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
Take advantage of the training that's available.  It will help you get started with some of the system features that are more complex.

What problems is SAP Marketing Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm a one-person marketing department so the main problem I'm solving is creating ongoing outbound marketing to create awareness and lead gen, without many resources available to me.  I'm creating content and need a good method for distribution, which this system provides.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The product has some tetchy moments (possibly browser dependent, possibly back-end). I hope the new designer tools (for landing pages and email templates) will improve rapidly based on feedback and testing.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
Be sure you have a really clear understanding of your marketing processes (trust me, everyone's is in need of improvement), a good handle on roles and responsibilities (sales and marketing) and a well resourced 'content marketing' team (or person) as this feeds everything else.

We did not have a systematic email (outbound) management system; we did not have any rigorous Inbound system or results. Both of these issues have been effectively addressed.

Ultimately, we handle a very low volume of web traffic, and the ROI was just not there for us.

all_reviews.review_title: LeadFormix
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
Easy to use, the right size for my company, and the right price.
We send out highly targeted emails to many small lists and it makes it easy for me to send the email at the same time, but still to all these lists so I can compare response rates of each list. I can then further customize my emails to each list if I want to.
I also like the way it is easy to score, build workflows, and integrate my other campaigns with it.
Probably best of all, it comes at the right price for smaller companies that need sophisticated marketing automation without having to spend a lot of money.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
My only peeve is that the import list feature comes with fixed columns. This has limited my ability to export more complete information (such as revenue, employee size, etc.) to Salesforce.com when the lead is ready to be exported.
Maybe there is a workaround I don't yet know about.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
I do use Eloqua and Marketo for some clients, but I still think that LeadFormix is the best marketing automation tool that gives a wide range of functionalists out of the box without a great deal of development and customization.
Also for the functionality that I use, it offers the best price/performance ratio

all_reviews.review_title: Leadformix Plays Nice with Small Businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
I like getting many of the features of a marketing automation tool without the hefty price tag to accompany it. It's more powerful than any email marketing tool and surprises me with its ability to connect the dots with web visitors. Its page tracking codes are powerful, as are its many other features. The biggest benefit is managing a lot of leads from website traffic and form fills.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
It could use better social media tool integration and some areas are a bit cryptic, even for seasoned marketers. The software has been undergoing some recent changes and improvements which I've appreciated, but I'd like to see it work a little more like Hubspot or Hootsuite, with a measure of ViralHeat added.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
It took me close to two years on my own to really get efficient at using all the aspects of this software. That's a pretty long learning curve these days, but I also started out with an integration of Salesforce Professional Edition at the same time, along with redesigning my websites. So it evolved, rather than fired right up - at least for me.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful marketing automation tool.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SAP Marketing Cloud?
1.  The ability to track the traffic to your website.  Coupled with the ability to score and segment traffic, Leadformix gives you a powerful tool for e-relationship building.
2.  Worlflow Automation:  The ability to create email campaign series and then automate them through workflow to send at a measure pace over time.  Further, the ability for LeadFormix to capture form fill information from our website and automatically load those users into preset workflows is a powerful follow up tool.

What do you dislike about SAP Marketing Cloud?
The user interface and navigation seems to have been designed by engineers void of typical consumer operator usability inputs.  It is not always easy to find features, reporting, etc.  Often times looking in the logical location does not yield results.  Often the function you are seeking is there, but it's not easy to find, nor is it accessible in multiple locations.

Recommendations to others considering SAP Marketing Cloud:
I recommend that you understand it will take time and/or resources to build the level of content you want to be effective.  Further, note it will take time to learn the setup of the software so you can begin to navigate it.  Finally, it will take time to build your understanding of users behaviors as they relate to your campaigns, website, etc.
